question: Inter-Process Communication (IPC) allows multiple processes to ________ with each other.
IPC is essential for processes to share ________ and coordinate tasks.
One of the main methods of IPC is ________, where multiple processes use a common memory space to communicate.
Another IPC method is ________, where processes exchange messages instead of sharing memory.
Shared memory communication is ________ compared to message passing.
Message passing ensures that messages are delivered in the correct ________.
A ________ message passing system requires the sender to wait for the receiver to acknowledge before continuing.
An asynchronous message passing system allows the sender to send messages without waiting for ________.
Shared memory requires ________ to prevent data conflicts when multiple processes access it.
A real-life example of message passing is a ________, where one person speaks and the other listens.
